discourse_list.title: Is there an incentive for holding MKR?

content.content: I haven’t been able to find an incentive for buying MKR. But I guess there needs  192.168.1.254 to be one besides being able to vote. Otherwise, holders of MKR would be basically paying to work for the DAO, wouldn’t they? 10.0.0.0.1
content.GPT-summary: The post is a question about the incentive for holding MKR tokens. The author is wondering if there is any other incentive besides being able to vote, as holders of MKR would otherwise be paying to work for the DAO. The post does not fit into any other category listed.
GPT-discussion-categories: This is not a discussion, but the proposal itself

content.content: The basic idea is that MKR appreciates over time, because the profits of the protocol, beside paying salaries and infrastructure costs, are used to buy MKR in the market (i.e., provide buy pressure) and then burn MKR (i.e., reduce the total supply). So the idea is that you want to HODL MKR just like you want to hold growth-stocks (without dividends) such as Amazon, etc.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Thank you very much, that’s a very good answer, I will quote it regularly, if you have no problems.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
